issues.debug:
The exception is triggered under the following conditions:

calldata_EthAnte_0: 0x13e2252a00000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000
calldatasize_EthAnte: 0x4
storage_2: 0x0
issues.description: A reachable exception (opcode 0xfe) has been detected. This can be caused by type errors, division by zero, out-of-bounds array access, or assert violations. This is acceptable in most situations. Note however that `assert()` should only be used to check invariants. Use `require()` for regular input checking.
issues.title: Exception state

issues.description:
A possible integer overflow exists in the function `fund()`.
The addition or multiplication may result in a value higher than the maximum representable integer.
issues.title: Integer Overflow

issues.description:
Multiple sends exist in one transaction, try to isolate each external call into its own transaction. As external calls can fail accidentally or deliberately.
Consecutive calls: 
Call at address: 721
issues.title: Multiple Calls

issues.description:
In the function `fallback` the following predictable state variables are used to determine Ether recipient:
- block.timestamp
issues.title: Dependence on predictable environment variable

issues.description: A possible transaction order independence vulnerability exists in function fallback. The value or direction of the call statement is determined from a tainted storage location
issues.title: Transaction order dependence
